refnamediv.refpurpose: Abstract base class for all pipeline elements

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GstElement is the base class needed to construct an element that can be used in a GStreamer pipeline. As such, it is not a functional entity, and cannot do anything when placed in a pipeline.
The name of a GstElement can be get with get_name and set with set_name.

All elements have pads (of the type gst.Pad). These pads link to pads on other elements. gst.Bufferflow between these linked pads. A gst.Element has a list of gst.Pad structures for all their input (or sink) and output (or source) pads. Core and plug-in writers can add and remove pads with add_pad and remove_pad.
A pad of an element can be retrieved by name with get_pad.

Elements can be linked through their pads. If the link is straightforward, use the link convenience function to link two elements, or gst.element_link_many for more elements in a row. Use link_filtered to link two elements constrained by a specified set of gst.Caps. For finer control, use link_pads and link_pads_filtered to specify the pads to link on each element by name.
Each element has a state (see States). You can get and set the state of an element with get_state and set_state. To get a string representation of a State , use gst.element_state_get_name.

You can get and set a gst.Clock on an element using get_clock and set_clock. Some elements can provide a clock for the pipeline if provides_clock returns True. With the provide_clock method one can retrieve the clock provided by such an element. Not all elements require a clock to operate correctly. If requires_clock returns True, a clock should be set on the element with set_clock. Note that clock slection and distribution is normally handled by the toplevel gst.Pipeline so the clock functions are only to be used in very specific situations.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.abort_state
refsect2.para: The abort_state() method abort the state change of the element. This function is used by elements that do asynchronous state changes and find out something is wrong.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.add_pad

listitem.simpara: The gst.Pad to add to the element.
True if the pad could be added. This function can fail when a pad with the same name already existed or the pad already had another parent.

refsect2.para: The add_pad() method adds a pad (link point) to element. Pad's parent will be set to element. Pads are not automatically activated so elements should perform the needed steps to activate the pad in case this pad is added in the PAUSED or PLAYING state. The pad and the element should be unlocked when calling this function.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.continue_state

listitem.simpara: The previous state return value.
The result of the commit state change.

refsect2.para: The continue_state() method commit the state change of the element and proceed to the next pending state if any. This function is used by elements that do asynchronous state changes. The core will normally call this method automatically when an element returned SUCCESS from the state change function. Elements that return ASYNC from the change_state function should eventually call this method from the streaming thread to signal successfull state change completion. If after calling this method the element still has not reached the pending state, the next state change is performed.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.create_all_pads
refsect2.para: The create_all_pads() method creates a pad for each pad template that is always available. This function is only useful during object intialization of subclasses of GstElement.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.flags

listitem.simpara: the entire set of flags for the object.

refsect2.para: The flags() method returns the entire set of flags for the object.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_base_time

listitem.simpara: the base time of the element.

refsect2.para: The get_base_time() method returns the base time of the element. The base time is the absolute time of the clock when this element was last put to PLAYING. Substracting the base time from the clock time gives the stream time of the element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_bus

listitem.simpara: the element's gst.Bus.

refsect2.para: The get_base_time() method returns the base time of the element. The base time is the absolute time of the clock when this element was last put to PLAYING. Substracting the base time from the clock time gives the stream time of the element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_clock

listitem.simpara: the gst.Clock of the element.

refsect2.para: The get_base_time() method returns the base time of the element. The base time is the absolute time of the clock when this element was last put to PLAYING. Substracting the base time from the clock time gives the stream time of the element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_compatible_pad

listitem.simpara: The gst.Pad to find a compatible one for.
The gst.Caps to use as a filter.
The gst.Pad to which a link can be made, or None if one cannot be found.

refsect2.para: The get_compatible_pad() method looks for an unlinked pad to which the given pad can link. It is not guaranteed that linking the pads will work, though it should work in most cases.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_compatible_pad_template

listitem.simpara: The gst.PadTemplate to find a compatible template for.
a compatible gst.PadTemplate or None if none was found.

refsect2.para: The get_compatible_pad_template() method retrieves a pad template from element that is compatible with compattempl. Pads from compatible templates can be linked together.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_factory

listitem.simpara: The gst.ElementFactory used for creating this element. no refcounting is needed.

refsect2.para: The get_factory() method retrieves the factory that was used to create this element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_index

listitem.simpara: A gst.Index or None when no index was set on the element.

refsect2.para: The get_index() method gets the index from the element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_pad

listitem.simpara: The name of the gst.Pad to retrieve
The gst.Pad if found, None otherwise.

refsect2.para: The get_pad() method retrieves a pad from element by name.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_pad_template

listitem.simpara: The name of the gst.PadTemplate to retrieve
The gst.PadTemplate if found, None otherwise.

refsect2.para: The get_pad_template() method retrieves a pad template from element by name.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_query_types

listitem.simpara: A list of Query Types elements.

refsect2.para: The get_query_types() method gets a list of query types from the element. If the element doesn't implement a query types function, the query will be forwarded to a random sink pad.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_request_pad

listitem.simpara: The name of the request gst.Pad to retrieve.
Requested gst.Pad if found, None otherwise.

refsect2.para: The get_request_pad() method retrieves a pad from the element by name. This version only retrieves request pads.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_state

listitem.simpara: A tuple of the states.

refsect2.para: The get_state() method returns a tuple of the elements current states.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.get_static_pad

listitem.simpara: The name of the static gst.Pad to retrieve.
Requested gst.Pad if found, None otherwise.

refsect2.para: The get_static_pad() method retrieves a pad from the element by name. This version only retrieves already-existing (i.e. 'static') pads.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.implement_interfaces

listitem.simpara: (final) type of the interface which we want to be implemented.
Whether or not the element implements the interface.

refsect2.para: The implement_interfaces() method test whether the given element implements a certain interface of type iface_type, and test whether it is supported for this specific instance.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.is_indexable

listitem.simpara: True if the element can be indexed.

refsect2.para: The is_indexable() method queries if the element can be indexed.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.is_locked_state

listitem.simpara: True if the element state is locked.

refsect2.para: The is_locked_state() method checks if the state of an element is locked. If the state of an element is locked, state changes of the parent don't affect the element. This way you can leave currently unused elements inside bins. Just lock their state before changing the state from GST_STATE_NULL.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.link

listitem.simpara: The gst.Element containing the destination pad.
True if the elements could be linked, False otherwise.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.link_filtered

listitem.simpara: The gst.Element containing the destination pad.
The gst.Pad to filter the link, or None for no filter.
True if the elements could be linked, False otherwise.

refsect2.para: The link_filtered() method links the current element to dest using the given caps as filtercaps. The link must be from source to destination; the other direction will not be tried. The function looks for existing pads that aren't linked yet. It will request new pads if necessary. If multiple links are possible, only one is established.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.link_pads

listitem.simpara: The name of the gst.Pad in source element or None for any pad.
The gst.Element containing the destination pad.
The name of the gst.Pad in destination element, or None for any pad.
True if the pad could be linked, False otherwise.

refsect2.para: The link_pads() method links the current element to dest using the given caps as filtercaps. The link must be from source to destination; the other direction will not be tried. The function looks for existing pads that aren't linked yet. It will request new pads if necessary. If multiple links are possible, only one is established.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.link_pads_filtered

listitem.simpara: The name of the gst.Pad in source element or None for any pad.
The gst.Element containing the destination pad.
The name of the gst.Pad in destination element, or None for any pad.
The gst.Caps to filter the caps, or None for no filter.
True if the pad could be linked, False otherwise.

refsect2.para: The link_pads_filtered() method links the two named pads of the source and destination elements. Side effect is that if one of the pads has no parent, it becomes a child of the parent of the other element. If they have different parents, the link fails. If caps is not None, makes sure that the caps of the link is a subset of caps.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.lost_state
refsect2.para: The lost_state() method brings the element to the lost state. The current state of the element is copied to the pending state so that any call to #gst_element_get_state() will return ASYNC. This is mostly used for elements that lost their preroll buffer in the PAUSED state after a flush, they become PAUSED again if a new preroll buffer is queued. This function can only be called when the element is currently not in error or an async state change. This function can only be called with the STATE_LOCK held.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.no_more_pads
refsect2.para: Use The no_more_pads() method to signal that the element does not expect any more pads to show up in the current pipeline. This function should be called whenever pads have been added by the element itself. Elements with GST_PAD_SOMETIMES pad templates use this in combination with autopluggers to figure out that the element is done initializing its pads.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.pads

listitem.simpara: The pads of this element.

refsect2.para: The pads() method returns the pads of this element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.post_message

listitem.simpara: A gst.Message to post.
True if the message was successfully posted.

refsect2.para: The post_message() method post a message on the element's gst.Bus. This function takes ownership of the message; if you want to access the message after this call, you should add an additional reference before calling.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.provide_clock

listitem.simpara: The gst.Clock provided by the element or None if no clock could be provided.

refsect2.para: The provide_clock() method gets the clock provided by the given element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.provides_clock

listitem.simpara: True if the element provides a clock.

refsect2.para: The provides_clock() method query if the element provides a clock. A gst.Clock provided by an element can be used as the global gst.Clock for the pipeline.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.query

listitem.simpara: The gst.Query.
True if the query could be performed.

refsect2.para: The query() method performs a query on the given element. If the format is set to GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT and this function returns True, the format pointer will hold the default format. For element that don't implement a query handler, this function forwards the query to a random usable sinkpad of this element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.query_convert

listitem.simpara: A gst.Format to convert from.
A value to convert.
A gst.Format to convert to.
The result.
True if the query could be performed.

refsect2.para: The query_convert() method queries an element to convert src_val in src_format to dest_format.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.query_duration

listitem.simpara: The gst.Format asked for. On return contains the gst.Format used.
A location in which to store the total duration, or None.
The value and the format constant.

refsect2.para: The query_duration() method queries an element for the total stream duration.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.query_position

listitem.simpara: The gst.Format asked for. On return contains the gst.Format used.
A location in which to store the current position, or None.
The value and the format constant.

refsect2.para: The query_position() method queries an element for the stream position.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.release_request_pad

listitem.simpara: The gst.Pad to release.

refsect2.para: The release_request_pad() method makes the element free the previously requested pad as obtained with get_request_pad

refsect2.title: gst.Element.remove_pad

listitem.simpara: The gst.Pad to remove from the element.
True if the pad could be removed. Can return False if the pad is not belonging to the provided element.

refsect2.para: The remove_pad() method removes pad from element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.requires_clock

listitem.simpara: True if the element requires a clock.

refsect2.para: The remove_pad() method query if the element requires a clock.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.seek

listitem.simpara: The new playback rate.
The format of the seek values.
The optional seek flags.
The type and flags for the new current position.
The value of the new current position.
The type and flags for the new stop position.
The value of the new stop position.
True if the event was handled.

refsect2.para: The seek() method sends a seek event to an element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.seek_simple

listitem.simpara: The format of the seek values.
The seek flag.
The value of the new current position.
True if the event was handled.

refsect2.para: The seek_simple() method sends a seek event to an element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.send_event

listitem.simpara: The gst.Event to send to the element.
True if the event was handled.

refsect2.para: The send_event() method sends an event to an element. If the element doesn't implement an event handler, the event will be forwarded to a random sink pad.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.set_base_time

listitem.simpara: The base time to set.

refsect2.para: The set_base_time() method set the base time of an element. See get_base_time

refsect2.title: gst.Element.set_bus

listitem.simpara: The gst.Bus to set.

refsect2.para: The set_bus() method sets the bus of the element. For internal use only, unless you're testing elements.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.set_clock

listitem.simpara: The gst.Clock to set to the element.
True if the element accepted the clock.

refsect2.para: The set_clock() method sets the clock for the element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.set_index

listitem.simpara: A gst.Index.

refsect2.para: The set_index() method sets index on the element.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.set_locked_state

listitem.simpara: True to lock the element's state.
True if the state was changed, False if bad parameterss were given or the elements state-locking needed no change if the element accepted the clock.

refsect2.para: The set_locked_state() method locks the state of an element, so state changes of the parent don't affect this element anymore.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.set_state

listitem.simpara: The element's new State.
Result of the state change between GST_STATE_CHANGE_FAILURE, GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS, GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC, GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL.

refsect2.para: The set_state() method sets the state of the element. This function will try to set the requested state by going through all the intermediary states and calling the class's state change function for each.

This function can return GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC, in which case the element will perform the remainder of the state change asynchronously in another thread. An application can use gst_element_get_state() to wait for the completion of the state change or it can wait for a state change message on the bus.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.sink_pads

listitem.simpara: The gst.Iterator of gst.Pad

refsect2.para: The sink_pads() method retrieves an iterator of element's sink pads.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.src_pads

listitem.simpara: The gst.Iterator of gst.Pad

refsect2.para: The sink_pads() method retrieves an iterator of element's source pads.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.sync_state_with_parent

listitem.simpara: True if the element's state could be synced to the parent's state.

refsect2.para: The sync_state_with_parent() method tries to change the state of the element to the same as its parent. If this function returns False, the state of element is undefined.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.unlink

listitem.simpara: The gst.Element to unlink.

refsect2.para: The unlink() unlinks all source pads of the source element with all sink pads of the sink element to which they are linked.

refsect2.title: gst.Element.unlink_pads

listitem.simpara: The name of the gst.Pad in source element.
A gst.Element containing the destination pad.
The name of the gst.Pad in destination element.

refsect2.para: The unlink_pads() unlinks the two named pads of the source and destination elements.

refsect2.title: gst.element_link_many

listitem.simpara: the first gst.Element in the link chain.
the second gst.Element in the link chain.
the last gst.Element in the link chain.
True on success, False otherwise.

refsect2.para: The element_link_many() function chain together a series of elements. Use link.

refsect2.title: gst.element_make_from_uri

listitem.simpara: Wether to create a source or a sink.
URI to create an element for.
Name of created element, can be None.
a new element or None if none could be created.

refsect2.para: The element_make_from_uri() function creates an element for handling the given URI.

refsect2.title: gst.element_state_get_name

listitem.simpara: A State to get the name of.
a string with the name of the state.

refsect2.para: The element_state_get_name() function returns a string with the name of the state.

refsect2.title: gst.element_unlink_many

listitem.simpara: The first gst.Element to unlink.
The second gst.Element to unlink.
The last gst.Element to unlink.

refsect2.para: The element_unlink_many() function unlinks all source pads of the source element with all sink pads of the sink element to which they are linked.

refsect2.title: The "no-more-pads" gst.Element Signal

listitem.simpara: The gstelement that received the signal
Additional data (if any) specified with the connect() method
Additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "no-more-pads" signal is emitted when the element will not generate more dynamic pads.

refsect2.title: The "pad-added" gst.Element Signal

listitem.simpara: The gstelement that received the signal
The pad that has been added.
Additional data (if any) specified with the connect() method
Additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "pad-added" signal is emitted when a new gst.Pad has been added to the element.

refsect2.title: The "pad-removed" gst.Element Signal

listitem.simpara: The gstelement that received the signal
The pad that has been removed.
Additional data (if any) specified with the connect() method
Additional user parameters (if any)

refsect2.para: The "pad-removed" signal is emitted when a gst.Pad has been removed from the element.
